creator: hyc@symas.com
text:
This is the same problem reported in
http://www.mailarchives.org/list/apache-modproxy-dev/msg/2004/00094

I have an authorization module that uses a cookie to track authorization state.
If  the cookie is generated on a request that gets proxied, the Set-Cookie
header is not propagated back to the client with the proxied request results.

I've also looked at bug 10722; that appears unrelated. (I.e., it seems to deal
with rewriting the path in cookies that originated on the target server, which
is a separate issue.)

creator: hyc@symas.com
text:
Created attachment 15698
Patch to copy cookies to proxy results.

This patch fixes the problem for me.

I'm also running Apache 2.0.54 as proxy with the RSA/ACE SecurID Agent for 
Web/Apache module. 
I experience the problem with the cookie not sticking, but the patch included  
above fixes the problem. Will this patch be included in the official Apache  
tree?
creator: johan.jacobsson@koppla.com

text:
(In reply to comment #2)

[..cut..] 

> above fixes the problem. Will this patch be included in the official Apache  
> tree? 

I don't think so for two reasons:

1. It is questionable to do this only for Set-Cookie. What about other headers
that might have been set?

2. The root cause for the problem is not in httpd, but in the buggy third party
module. The code of the module mod_headers which is delivered with httpd shows
how to do this correctly by using output filters for this task. So please
contact the vendor of your third party module to get this fixed.
